pros: Pay, co workers, leadership, best place to work as a nurse in Indianapolis
cons: There isn’t many cons. Still suffering some staffing shortage.

review_title: Not what I think “community” stands for
pros: Love the patient population, very appreciative of my services.
cons: I felt I was constantly having to be a patient advocate to this company. I felt like numbers were the top priority, over patients and employees.

pros: Free lunches sometimes Cell phone usage flexibility Multiple locations to choose from
cons: Hostile work environment Poor management Unprofessional dressing, nightclub wear, and assets and personal piercings exposed with management Terrible gossiping, nothing is private there, management will not keep anything private and are the ones spreading gossip, lies told about employees, if you aren't in "the click" then you're nothing, Management is dating CEO so the culture of the Houston location is terrible 150 turnovers this year alone with this company This company being predominantly Medicaid or medicare patients, it is already a stressful environment as it can be more challenging and demanding, the management should be there to help staff but this is not the case They take hours from your PTO without consent if you don't make a 40-hour week This could be a good place to work if the management was better trained and created a better culture as this starts from the top down, examples have to be set.

pros: Good coworkers, benefits offered if you want them
cons: Management is petty and if you aren’t in their circle, you’ll be bullied into quitting. If you’re sick it will be come back to be counted against you. Can’t ever take lunch because of short staffing and high acuities, but aren’t allowed to say you didn’t take one.

review_title: Sad this company used to not be so Toxic
pros: Great doctors who care for their patients
cons: Toxic work environment, nepotism, medicaid fraud, no work life balance their always under staffed so you work 11 plus hours a day most times with no lunch, Unprofessional attire from management coming in in crop-tops, management hires their friends and family who have no experience nor training, OSHA violations, over worked and under paid, they can't find staff so you always have Temps, schedules are so full patients are standing, management wants you to hang out with them on your off days they call it team building but in actuality it's just drinking. HR is terrible exposed unprofessional piercings.

review_title: It's a great place to grow!
pros: You get to work with Directors and Chiefs. They listen to you, and you actually get more hands-on experience ("real world experience").
cons: The company is growing, so there are some aches and pains that come with it!
